Manning: and though Descartes was interested in actio, he was describing sub-visible phenomena. That is, he was describing the mechanisms of things he had never seen. (This, I think, is the central paradox of Descartes‚Äôs pictures.)

Manning: early Modern anatomy is a four-part study: historia (how things are) > actio (how things work) > used (what thing are for); relays historian to usus (final cause). Descartes not interested in usus but actio!
